diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Concurrent Bilateral Femoral Neck Stress Fractures and Osteonecrosis of the Hip
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with bilateral groin pain, with MRI revealing nondisplaced subcapital fractures and stage-I osteonecrosis of both femoral heads. The surgical treatment involved internal fixation which stabilized the stress fractures and coincidentally performed core decompression for the osteonecrosis.
